---
title: "Exploratory Data Analysis"
output: html_notebook
---

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
appstore_df <- read.csv("../Data/AppleStore.csv")
appstore_df %>% arrange(X)
summary(appstore_df)
```

We will first add certain variables to the data set that are more relevant (like total size of an app in megabytes).
```{r}
appstore_df <- mutate(appstore_df, size_mb = size_bytes/1000000)
```


We can see how the popularity of certain genres with this graph below.
```{r}
appstore_df %>% ggplot() + geom_boxplot(mapping = aes(x=prime_genre, y = log10(rating_count_tot), color=prime_genre)) + coord_flip() + theme_minimal()
```

We can see the distribution of the app sizes throughout the ~7000 apps in the data set.
```{r}
appstore_df %>% ggplot() + geom_histogram(mapping = aes(x=size_mb), bins = 20) + geom_vline(mapping= aes(xintercept= median(appstore_df$size_mb))) + geom_vline(mapping= aes(xintercept= mean(appstore_df$size_mb), color="Red"))
```
